marketNews.title: Menkeu Optimis Ekonomi RI +5,5% YoY pada 4Q25
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, said on Tuesday (9/30) that he is optimistic Indonesian economic growth in 4Q25 can reach +5.5% YoY. This growth, according to Purbaya, will occur across various sectors (across the board), although it will primarily be seen in the property sector - in line with increased credit disbursement from banking - and the food and beverage sector due to increased economic activity. In line with Purbaya, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, also expressed optimism regarding economic growth in 4Q25, which he said will be driven by government spending including fiscal stimulus during the Christmas and New Year holiday period worth approximately 2 billion US dollars or ~30 trillion rupiah. For comparison, the Bloomberg consensus survey in September 2025 predicted that Indonesian economic growth in 4Q25 would only reach +4.7% YoY. On a separate occasion, Purbaya also affirmed that he would not consider easing the fiscal deficit limit until the Indonesian economy can grow faster with more efficient spending. Meanwhile, on Wednesday (10/1), BPS released inflation and trade balance data that exceeded consensus expectations. Indonesian inflation in September 2025 was recorded at 2.65% YoY (vs. August 2025: 2.31% YoY, September 2024: 1.84% YoY), higher than the consensus expectation of 2.5% YoY. Meanwhile, core inflation was recorded at 2.19% YoY in September 2025 (vs. August 2025: 2.17% YoY inflation, September 2024: 2.09% YoY inflation), slightly lower than the consensus expectation of 2.2% YoY. Furthermore, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 5.49 billion US dollars in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: 4.17 billion US dollars, August 2024: 2.76 billion US dollars), exceeding the consensus expectation which projected a surplus of 3.99 billion US dollars. This result was driven by export growth of +5.78% YoY in August 2025, exceeding the consensus expectation of +5% YoY. Meanwhile, imports in August 2025 fell by -6.56% YoY, lower than the consensus expectation of -2% YoY.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that core inflation data which is still relatively low and the still slow pace of credit growth indicate that - at least until August 2025 - there are no signs of an increase in public purchasing power/demand. Therefore, investors need to monitor the impact of various government initiatives - such as liquidity injection, fiscal stimulus, to increased government spending in general - and the Bank Indonesia interest rate cut. Meanwhile, the release of trade balance data and news of a US government shutdown appeared to provide a positive sentiment for the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar, which strengthened by +0.3% on Wednesday (10/1) to the level of 16,610.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: The US officially experienced a government shutdown as of Wednesday (10/1) early morning local time, following the Senate's failure to pass the federal budget bill. This marks the first US government shutdown since 2018-2019. A government shutdown can cause some US government services to temporarily halt. Bloomberg reported that OPEC+ is considering the option of accelerating oil production increases by approximately 500,000 barrels per day in the meeting on October 5, 2025. This amount is higher than previous Reuters reports, which mentioned that OPEC+ in the meeting would most likely decide on a production increase of at least 137,000 barrels per day starting from November 2025. Bloomberg sources said that OPEC+ in the meeting would accelerate the production recovery from voluntary cuts totaling approximately 1.66 million barrels per day, which was initially targeted to end only at the end of 2026. One of the options being considered is increasing monthly production by approximately 500,000 barrels per day over 3 months, although the final decision on this matter is not yet final. S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) slowed to 50.4 in September 2025 (vs. September 2024: 49.2), marking two consecutive months of factory activity expansion despite being down from August 2025 at 51.5, which was the highest level in the last 5 months. S&P Global Market Intelligence Economist, Usamah Bhatti, in his report said that this result was driven by an increase in new demand, although production volume decreased compared to the previous month because companies recorded a decline in client purchasing power. Bhatti added that companies are confident that the improvement in demand conditions at the end of 3Q25 will continue into next year, while manufacturing sector confidence related to output for the next 12 months has also strengthened to its highest level in the last 4 months. S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.2 in September 2025 (vs. August 2025: 50.5; September 2024: 49.3), exceeding the consensus expectation of 50.3 while marking the highest level since March 2025. This result was driven by output growing at the fastest pace in the last 3 months, while new export orders rose for the first time in the last 6 months. In addition, new business experienced expansion at the fastest pace since February 2025, which boosted purchasing activity to grow at the fastest rate since November 2024. Going forward, business sentiment improved amid expectations of increased sales and production, supported by business development efforts and Chinese government policies. Danantara CEO, Rosan Roeslani, said on Tuesday (9/30) that his party would launch 33 waste-to-energy power plant (PSEL) projects, 8 of which will be launched at the end of October 2025. Danantara will also open tenders for private parties interested in participating in this project. Rosan explained that each PSEL will manage at least 1,000 tons of waste per day to generate 15 MW of electricity for 20,000 households. Danantara projects that each PSEL unit with an input capacity of 1,000 tons of waste per day requires 4-5 hectares of land, with an investment cost ranging from 2-3 trillion rupiah per project. BPS noted that the number of foreign tourist visits to Indonesia reached approximately 1.5 million people in August 2025 (+12.3% YoY, +1.6% MoM). This result causes the cumulative number of foreign tourist visits during 8M25 to grow by +10.4% YoY to approximately 10 million people, equivalent to 63-72% of the government's 2025 target in the range of 14-16 million people.

marketNews.title: Filosofi Price to Momentum Value
marketNews.content: "Momentum expert doesn't chase high prices, but patiently waits in the value zone: EMA 20 is the center of gravity for momentum." - ariefhidayatst

tickerNews.title: $NISP: Bank OCBC NISP reports Bank Only Net Profit of 427 billion rupiah in August 2025
tickerNews.content: NISP: Bank OCBC NISP recorded bank only net profit of 427 billion rupiah in August 2025 (+34% YoY, -4% MoM), bringing bank only net profit for 8M25 to 3.4 trillion rupiah (-4% YoY). The net profit performance in August 2025 was supported by: 1) PPOP growth (+25% YoY) along with an increase in Non-Interest Income to 250 billion rupiah (vs. August 2024: 9 billion rupiah); and 2) other non-operating income recorded a profit of 1.9 billion rupiah (vs. August 2024: loss of 80 billion rupiah). During 8M25, net profit was pressured by provision expenses of 158 billion rupiah (vs. August 2024: provision reversal of 500 billion rupiah), although PPOP still grew +14% YoY. Net Interest Income rose +3% YoY during 8M25, but the growth trend slowed down compared to the April-June 2025 period which was in the range of +5-7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang announces capital injection to subsidiary PT Feni Haltim
tickerNews.content: ANTM: Aneka Tambang announced that it has deposited capital of 159.6 million US dollars or ~2.6 trillion rupiah into its subsidiary, PT Feni Haltim, which is jointly owned with the Hong Kong consortium CBL Ltd. PT Feni Haltim is currently building an RKEF smelter with a capacity of 88,000 tons of NPI per year. In this transaction, Hong Kong CBL Ltd. also added a capital injection of 3.95 trillion rupiah, so ANTM's ownership stake in PT Feni Haltim remains unchanged at 40%.

tickerNews.title: $MMLP: Astra International ($ASII) subsidiary acquires Mega Manunggal Property
tickerNews.content: MMLP: Astra International (ASII) through its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, announced that the acquisition price for Mega Manunggal Property is 580.6 rupiah per share, making the total transaction value reach 3.3 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya has become the new controller of MMLP and will conduct a mandatory tender offer. Previously, ASII announced that its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, had signed an agreement to acquire 83.67% of MMLP shares from PT Suwarna Arta Mandiri, Bridge Leed Limited, and several other minority shareholders on July 22, 2025.

tickerNews.title: $COCO: Wahana Interfood Nusantara announces rights issue details
tickerNews.content: COCO: Wahana Interfood Nusantara announced that the exercise price for the rights issue is 100 rupiah per share. In this corporate action, COCO will issue approximately 2.67 billion new shares with a 1:3 ratio and up to 75% dilution potential. Potential fund acquisition reaches approximately 267 billion rupiah, which will be used for capital expenditure for business development - especially in the midstream sector - and working capital. The company's controller, Mahogany Global Investment Pte. Ltd., will exercise all its rights and will act as a standby buyer for up to approximately 868.5 million new shares. Cum rights on the regular and negotiation market is on October 8, 2025, while the rights trading period is on October 14-20, 2025.

tickerNews.title: $AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Commissioner Alexander Ramlie sells 20 million shares
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Commissioner, Alexander Ramlie, sold 20 million AMMN shares at an average price of 7,675 rupiah per share on September 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 153.5 billion rupiah and was intended for share collateral restructuring purposes. After this transaction, Alexander Ramlie's ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.462% to 0.435%.

tickerNews.title: $DEWA: Darma Henwa shareholders approve changes in Board of Directors and Commissioners
tickerNews.content: DEWA: Darma Henwa shareholders on Tuesday (9/30) approved changes to the company's Board of Directors and Commissioners. In the decision, Joseph Lembayung was appointed as Director of Digital Transformation and Information Technology, a new director position to support digitalization plans. In addition, Wisnu Wahyudin Pettalolo and Sorimuda Pulungan were appointed as Commissioners, while Agus Suharyono was appointed as Independent Commissioner. The EGM also respectfully dismissed Ashok Mitra from the position of Commissioner and Kanaka Puradiredja from the position of Independent Commissioner.

tickerNews.title: $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital establishes new subsidiary PT Solusi Sinergi Borneo (SSB)
tickerNews.content: WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital announced that it has established a new subsidiary named PT Solusi Sinergi Borneo (SSB), with a 70% ownership by WIFI and 30% by PT Sinergi Integrasi Borneo. SSB will focus on the fields of internet service provider, telecommunication equipment trading, and trading of various types of goods. The establishment of this subsidiary is intended to support the company's expansion and business broadening.

tickerNews.title: $RMKE: RMK Energy Controller PT RMK Investama sells 875 million shares
tickerNews.content: RMKE: RMK Energy's Controller, PT RMK Investama, sold 875 million RMKE shares at an average price of 890 rupiah per share on September 29-30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 778.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT RMK Investama's ownership in RMKE decreased from 76.8% to 56.8%.

tickerNews.title: $AGII: Samator Indo Gas Controller Matrix Company Limited sells shares to meet free float requirements
tickerNews.content: Samator Indo Gas (AGII) Controller, Matrix Company Limited, sold approximately 6.83 million AGII shares on September 30, 2025, at an average price of 764 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 5.2 billion rupiah and was intended to fulfill free float requirements. After this transaction, Matrix Company Limited's ownership decreased from 32.45% to 32.23%.

tickerNews.title: $WIRG: Wir Asia Controller PT Wir Global Kreatif sells 44.5 million shares
tickerNews.content: Wir Asia (WIRG) Controller, PT Wir Global Kreatif, sold 44.5 million WIRG shares at an average price of approximately 138 rupiah per share on September 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Wir Global Kreatif's ownership in WIRG decreased from approximately 5.02% to approximately 4.65%.
